intro: Iridorkis orbicularis, commonly known as the orbicular iris, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of the northern hemisphere. It is characterized by its broad, rounded leaves and showy, violet-blue flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters and prefers well-drained soil in partial shade. Its flowers are composed of three petals and three sepals, with a distinctive three-lobed stigma. Iridorkis orbicularis is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ease of care.
